name: deviceManagement_GetGroupPolicyUploadedDefinitionFiles
description: The available group policy uploaded definition files for this account.

$block: The entity represents an ADMX (Administrative Template) XML file. The ADMX file contains a collection of group policy definitions and their locations by category path. The group policy definition file also contains the languages supported as determined by the language dependent ADML (Administrative Template) language files.

$ul: **@odata.type** (default: #microsoft.graph.groupPolicyUploadedDefinitionFile)
**id**: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
**definitions**: The group policy definitions associated with the file.
**description**: The localized description of the policy settings in the ADMX file. The default value is empty.
**displayName**: The localized friendly name of the ADMX file.
**fileName**: The file name of the ADMX file without the path. For example: edge.admx
**languageCodes**: The supported language codes for the ADMX file.
**lastModifiedDateTime**: The date and time the entity was last modified.
**policyType**: Type of Group Policy File or Definition.
**revision**: The revision version associated with the file.
**targetNamespace**: Specifies the URI used to identify the namespace within the ADMX file.
**targetPrefix**: Specifies the logical name that refers to the namespace within the ADMX file.
**content**: The contents of the uploaded ADMX file.
**defaultLanguageCode**: The default language of the uploaded ADMX file.
**groupPolicyOperations**: The list of operations on the uploaded ADMX file.
**groupPolicyUploadedLanguageFiles**: The list of ADML files associated with the uploaded ADMX file.
**status**: Type of Group Policy uploaded definition file status.
**uploadDateTime**: The uploaded time of the uploaded ADMX file.
**error**
**code**
**details**
**innererror**
**@odata.type**
**Date**: Date when the error occured.
**client-request-id**: Client request Id as sent by the client application.
**request-id**: Request Id as tracked internally by the service

**target**
